2117.note: One-line fix: vscode.Uri.parse('file:///'+path) -> vscode.Uri.file(path). Build not possible due to no network/node_modules.

Run 6: Completed full label backlog pass - all currently open issues now have at least one standard label (bug/enhancement/performance). label_backlog_cursor set to 'complete' meaning a full pass has been done once.
Run 7: Triaged #2086, #2046, #2041 from mid-range backlog. Next cursor: #2041.
Run 8: Triaged #2007 and #2013 - both are caused by segmentRegex in TestExplorer.fs treating '+' and '.' as hierarchy separators. Root cause identified, commented on both issues.
Issue #2007: Expecto '+' in test names creates false hierarchy - root cause: segmentRegex @'([+\.]?)([^+\.]+)' in TestExplorer.fs
Issue #2013: '.' in test names creates extra hierarchy nodes - same segmentRegex root cause
Issue #2026: Case-only module rename breaks Ionide - already acknowledged by TheAngryByrd as a confirmed bug; no need to comment
Issue #2039: vscode extension update breaks debugging - labeled 'upstream - csharp extension'; 2 comments, well-handled
Issue #2035: v7.21.0 intellisense issues - labeled 'bug' and 'upstream - FCS issue'; 12 comments, well-handled
